InitialNote: First case recorded in Togo - hence testing had commenced. Woman was symptomatic and deemed eligible. https://web.archive.org/web/20200618225616/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/togo-confirms-1st-coronavirus-case/1757546

International public events are cancelled.   "Annulation de tous les événements internationaux prévus au Togo pendant trois semaines, à compter de ce jour 16 mars 2020"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

Directions about handwashing, social distancing etc on gov website.   "Renforcement de la surveillance et des mesures individuelles et collectives de prévention et de protection: se laver les mains au savon, recourir au gel hydro-alcoolique, ne pas se serrer les mains en se saluant, éviter des accolades et des embrassades, etc"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

"Interdiction de tout rassemblement de plus de 100 personnes sur toute l’étendue du territoire nationale, pour un mois, à compter du jeudi 19 mars 2020 à minuit."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

Closure of all schools:  "La fermeture immédiate de tous les établissements scolaires publics, privés et confessionnels, primaires, secondaires et universitaires pour une période de trois (03) semaines."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

All nightclubs must close across the country, however other workplaces appear to remain open or just have reduced opening hours.   "La fermeture immédiate des discothèques sur toute l’étendue du territoire national"https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/
Recommendation to limit unnecessary travel.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

"As part of the measures envisaged by the government to prevent the spread of the coronavirus epidemic, the following additional measures have been taken:  The closure for two weeks, from this Friday March 20, 2020 at midnight of all the land borders of our country to passengers. This measure does not apply to the movement of goods."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

Nationwide, citizens asked to 'limit unnecessary travel'. However, the government also announces "the closure of certain towns, notably Lomé, Tsévié, Kpalimé and Sokodé, from Saturday March 21, 2020 at 6 a.m., with strict controls at the entrances at Tsévié on the national road N ° 1; from the toll of Aného on the national road N ° 2 and of Amoussou-Copé on the national road N ° 5".     https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/
Free water and electricity for 3mths  "Gratuité de l’eau et de l’électricité pour les tranches sociales pour 3 mois"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

"A state of emergency was declared on 2 April for 3 months and there is a curfew from 8 pm to 6am. An anti-pandemic special force has been put in place to police the curfew."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615193937/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/togo/staying-during-coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

"Le Gouvernement lance « Novissi », un programme de transferts monétaires pour soutenir les populations les plus affectées par les mesures prises dans le cadre de la riposte nationale contre le coronavirus (COVID-19) au Togo."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615195439/https://covid19.gouv.tg/To support eligible Togolese citizens in the informal sector whose daily income has been disrupted by the Coronavirus crisis, the Government of Togo has set up the “NOVISSI” cash transfer scheme. NOVISSI provides monthly financial aid to the most vulnerable individuals and families throughout the duration of the state of health emergency."https://web.archive.org/save/https://novissi.gouv.tg/en/home-new-en/

Masks recommended for members of public and mandatory for health workers    https://web.archive.org/web/20201012151829/https://www.togofirst.com/en/health/2004-5377-coronavirus-from-now-on-all-health-workers-must-wear-face-masks

"To contain the spread of the coronavirus, Togolese authorities plan to test more people and actively monitor suspected cases. The information was recently given by the national coordination team for the Covid-19 response. According to the latter, Lomé’s strategy revolves around testing suspects, quarantining and treating them, and finally tracking them. "  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618222912/https://www.togofirst.com/en/health/2605-5593-test-treat-track-togo-s-strategy-to-contain-the-covid-19-pandemic

In Togo, authorities lifted the curfew set at the beginning of April 2020 to contain the spread of the Coronavirus. This was announced yesterday, June 6.     Subsequently, the lockdown measure imposed on towns has been lifted as well. However, starting today, June 9, 2020, it is compulsory for every citizen to wear face masks (the measure applied only to health agents previously).     https://web.archive.org/web/20201012152033/https://www.togofirst.com/en/health/0906-5681-covid-19-togo-lifts-curfew-and-makes-it-compulsory-for-all-to-wear-face-masks

Plan to open for students to sit exams.   Le gouvernement togolais a annoncé vendredi que les écoles et les établissements d’enseignement secondaires seront de nouveau ouverts à compter du lundi 08 juin pour accueillir les classes d’examens uniquement.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200615222428/https://www.aa.com.tr/fr/afrique/togo-r%C3%A9ouverture-des-%C3%A9coles-pour-les-classes-d-examen-%C3%A0-partir-de-lundi/1867519
The Government announced on June 8 that the curfew would be completely lifted on June 9, with masks becoming compulsory.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200716094521/https://covid19.gouv.tg/
Government announces the "lifting of the closure of the towns initially concerned", alongside the curfew being lifted.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200716094521/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

Free water and electricity provision to certain social groups was announced for 3 months starting 1 April. I cannot find any source of that being extended. There is no mention of it in the government's official covid-19 website, or in recent news.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200716094521/https://covid19.gouv.tg/

The government has authorised the reopening of worship places starting from July 17.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200724102048/https://www.republiquetogolaise.com/culture/2007-4500-reouverture-partielle-effective-des-lieux-de-cultes

Ethiopian Airlines, Air France, Brussels Airlines, and ASKY have resumed most routine flights to and from Lome International Airport as of the week of August 2, 2020. If travellers arrive on an international flight, they are expected to spend one to two days under personal quarantine at a hotel or private residence in Lome. After this period and subject to the result of the test, travellers will be required to quarantine for 14 to 21 days. However, land crossings are still closed.  Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20200821124511/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Public Events and gathering restrictions remain in place despite lifting other lockdown restrictions. Only religious gatherings are allowed to open. However, this does not apply to all religious gatherings.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200724102048/https://www.republiquetogolaise.com/culture/2007-4500-reouverture-partielle-effective-des-lieux-de-cultes  https://web.archive.org/web/20200817204736/https://www.worldaware.com/covid-19-alert-togo-eases-restrictions-june-9-border-closures-remain

"La prise de la Pierre Sacrée, édition 2020 annulée  Publié le mercredi, 09 septembre 2020 11:55     (Togo Officiel) - Initialement prévue pour ce jeudi 10 septembre, « la cérémonie de la 357ème édition de la prise de la Pierre Sacrée de cette année 2020 n’aura pas lieu ». C’est ce qu’a annoncé le Trône royal de Glidji (préfecture des Lacs), autorité organisatrice de l’évènement.    La décision est prise en respect aux directives gouvernementales concernant les fêtes traditionnelles, et afin d’éviter la contamination à grande échelle de la population dans l’espace Guin, comme cela a pu être observé dans d’autres localités où se sont déroulées des festivités traditionnelles et culturelles.    Un bouclage préventif de la préfecture avait été également annoncé, toujours afin de limiter au mieux la propagation.    Lire aussi  "  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200913233222/https://www.republiquetogolaise.com/culture/0909-4619-la-prise-de-la-pierre-sacree-edition-2020-annulee

"Last Updated: 09/04/2020  While numbers of COVID-19 cases remain relatively low in Togo, the country extended its state of emergency for the second time, until Sept. 15. Borders are closed, public meetings of more than 15 people are banned, and schools are closed except for certain grades in which exams are mandatory. Masks are required in public. Churches are partially opened."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200913233915/https://www.compassion.com/crisis/covid-19/togo-covid19.htm

Is a curfew in place? [Yes]    On July 9, the Government lifted the curfew that was put in place on April 1.    Source: Covid-19.gouv  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? [Yes]    On August 24, the Government of Togo imposed a curfew in Sokodé (211 miles north of Lomé) and in the neighboring cities of Tchamba (19 miles east of Sokodé) and Adjengré (27 miles south). These measures are intended to limit a possible spread of COVID-19 cases in those locations following an increase in cases there. All land border crossings with Ghana, Burkina Faso and Benin remain closed. If you reside outside of Togo in West Africa,  please contact the U.S. Embassy in your country for assistance. For a detailed list of the flights available in country, visit our COVID-19 page.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200913222242/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

"Is public transportation operating? [Yes]"     "Is a curfew in place? [Yes]    On July 9, the Government lifted the curfew that was put in place on April 1.    Source: Covid-19.gouv  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? [Yes]    On August 24, the Government of Togo imposed a curfew in Sokodé (211 miles north of Lomé) and in the neighboring cities of Tchamba (19 miles east of Sokodé) and Adjengré (27 miles south). These measures are intended to limit a possible spread of COVID-19 cases in those locations following an increase in cases there. All land border crossings with Ghana, Burkina Faso and Benin remain closed. If you reside outside of Togo in West Africa,  please contact the U.S. Embassy in your country for assistance. For a detailed list of the flights available in country, visit our COVID-19 page." "Are commercial flights operating? [Yes]"    "Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? [Yes]    You should expect to spend one to two days under personal quarantine at a hotel or private residence in Lomé. You should limit your contact with anyone during this time. After this period, if it is determined by the Togo Ministry of Health from your nasal swab that you may have COVID-19, you will be required to quarantine for 14 to 21 days at the Eda-Oba Hotel in Lomé at your own expense until being cleared by the Ministry of Health to resume your activities in Togo.    The U.S. Embassy in Lomé will not intervene in a Togo required quarantine unless the quarantine exceeds 21 days and you have submitted to at least three nasal swab tests during quarantine."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200913222242/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

"Upon arrival at Lomé, travelers should also be prepared to install the contact tracing mobile application TOGO SAFE, and keep it activated for the duration of their stay or at least 30 days from their arrival in Togo."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200913222242/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/
Working hours are from 8:00am - 4:00pm until further notice.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201015101141/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/togo/coronavirus

Is public transportation operating? [Yes]  Services continue with reduced passengers. All moto-taxis and their passengers must wear face masks per government decree    https://web.archive.org/web/20201015075535/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Is a curfew in place? [Yes]  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? [Yes]  As part of the monitoring of the evolution of the COVID-19 pandemic, in response to the Coronavirus, the Government of Togo has been observing a worrying increase in new cases of coronavirus infection throughout the country for several weeks, particularly in the following towns: Sokodé, Tchamba and Adjengré.  Having noted that the infected persons have had many contacts, and in order to prevent this spread from increasing further in the populations of these localities and throughout the country, the government has decided the following as of August 25, 2020:  1- The closure of the cities of: Sokodé, Tchamba and Adjengre.  2- The establishment of a curfew from 21.00 to 5.00 in the prefectures of Tchaoudjo, Tchamba and Sotouboua.  All land border crossings with Ghana, Burkina Faso and Benin remain closed. If you reside outside of Togo in West Africa,  please contact the U.S. Embassy in your country for assistance. For a detailed list of the flights available in country, visit our COVID-19 page.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201015075535/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? [Yes]  You should expect to spend one to two days under personal quarantine at a hotel or private residence in Lomé. You should limit your contact with anyone during this time. After this period, if it is determined by the Togo Ministry of Health from your nasal swab that you may have COVID-19, you will be required to quarantine for 14 to 21 days at the Eda-Oba Hotel in Lomé at your own expense until being cleared by the Ministry of Health to resume your activities in Togo.  The U.S. Embassy in Lomé will not intervene in a Togo required quarantine unless the quarantine exceeds 21 days and you have submitted to at least three nasal swab tests during quarantine    https://web.archive.org/web/20201015075535/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

The Government subsidized water and electricity use for groups paying social tariffs for three months. The total cost is estimated at CFAF 3.8 billion ($6 million; 0.1 percent of GDP).  The Government did also subsidize water and electricity use for groups paying social tariffs for three months. The total cost is estimated at CFAF 3.8 billion ($6 million; 0.1 percent of GDP).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201015095720/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

School re-opening was scheduled for 26 October, but postponed until 2 November. Schools have re-opened, however, precautions remain in place (therefore: 1G).  https://web.archive.org/web/20201024135007/https://www.panapress.com/Coronavirus-Start-of-school-year-a_630665158-lang2.html

Restaurants, bars, night clubs, are open and expected to follow social distancing and hygiene guidelines.Stores and markets remain open. Cultural Centers present a reduced number of activities. ***Most religious services and churches remain closed***, a small number are open on a trial basis.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201129090128/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

As per this page last updated on 6 Aug, "Togo has lifted stay at home orders"  http://web.archive.org/web/20201129094706/https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/traveladvisories/traveladvisories/togo-travel-advisory.html

Per the US Embassy in Togo, "Cultural and commercial events (shows, advertising events) and celebrations (weddings, baptisms, etc.) are prohibited from December 20th through January 3rd. Celebrations of worship are banned except one day per week (Friday for Muslims and Sunday for Christians) from December 20th to January 3rd.  Celebrations are permitted on December 24th, 25th, 31st and January 1st in strict compliance with the measures and curfew schedules. In Lomé, these are permitted only in places of worship previously authorized to open." - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223511/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Per the US Embassy in Togo, "Everyone must adhere to the barrier measures such as hand washing, masking and distancing – at all times and in all places" https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223511/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Curfew to end on 3 Jan    Per the US Embassy in Togo, "In Lomé, a nightly curfew (from 22:00 to 05:00) will be effective as of Sunday, December 20th through Sunday, January 3rd.  Exceptions will be on December 24th, 25th, and 31st when the curfew will start at 23:00. Outside of Lomé, in the rest of the Republic of Togo, the curfew will take place on December 24th, 25th and 31st and on the 1st of January 2021 from 23:00 to 05:00" - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223511/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Curfew to end on 3 Jan    Per the US Embassy in Togo, "In Lomé, a nightly curfew (from 22:00 to 05:00) will be effective as of Sunday, December 20th through Sunday, January 3rd.  Exceptions will be on December 24th, 25th, and 31st when the curfew will start at 23:00. Outside of Lomé, in the rest of the Republic of Togo, the curfew will take place on December 24th, 25th and 31st and on the 1st of January 2021 from 23:00 to 05:00" - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223511/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Schools are open for International primary & secondary schools.  Local schools present some difficulties in reopening, however according to UNESCO's site as of 01/24/2021 all schools in TOGO are open.    /web/20210124203924/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

All business are open as long as all social distancing mandates are followed. Cultural centers must reduce number of activities and most religious services and churches remain closed.    NOTE:  Some cultural centers and also some religious sites remain closed, with cavoites for a small number on a trial bases as of 01/19/21.    /web/20210124203924/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

Restrictions are placed on business as they have to follow social distancing guidelines, and also churches are mostly closed except for the small number that are open on a trial bases as of 01.19.2021   /web/20210124203924/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/  Confirmed that gatherings limited to less than 100 people.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210124203202/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

I chose screening although it is more of tracking via TOGO app which was referenced on the US Embassy Site - They have a contact tracking app that is for residents and travelers alike.    /web/20210124203924/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210124212943/https://togosafe.gouv.tg/en/home/

International primary and secondary schools are open, while local schools present some difficulties in reopening. Reasonable to assume that they are following social distancing measures/safety precautions (mask wearing, especially since this is mandated across the country). See https://web.archive.org/web/20210209062627/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

All sport or cultural events have been adjourned. Cultural Centres present a reduced number of activities. Most religious services and churches remain closed, a small number are open on a trial basis.See https://web.archive.org/web/20210209063334/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19. See also https://web.archive.org/web/20210209062627/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/
Gatherings of more than 100 people are banned. See https://web.archive.org/web/20210209063334/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Public transport operating with reduced passengers. All motor-taxis and their passengers must wear face masks per government decree. See https://web.archive.org/web/20210209062627/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

No measures evident, but there was a nightly curfew was imposed in the northern and central regions in January 2021. See https://web.archive.org/web/20210209062627/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/. See also https://web.archive.org/web/20210209063334/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Negative PCR test required and some passengers, like those coming from the US, should expect to be placed in quarantine. See https://web.archive.org/web/20210209062627/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

No indication that measures were extended to 2021. For example, the last time that the Novissi - cash transfer programme launched in April - was revised was in June 2020. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210209063334/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

No indication that the measures were extended to 2021. For example, the Government did subsidise water and electricity use for groups paying social tariffs, but this was only for three months in 2020. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210209063334/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Per the guidelines it appears there are no manditory or official guidelines that say schools should be closed.  It appears urban schools are open however rural schools can open but appear to be having issues with reopening.  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210220172231/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104230410/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/togo  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210221170510/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Everything seems to indicate that everything is opening or on the way to opening as long as social distancing and mask wearing guidelines are followed.  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210220172231/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104230410/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/togo  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210221170510/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

All public transportation appears to be open as long as, mask wearing and social distancing guidelines must be followed.  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210220172231/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104230410/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/togo  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210221170510/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

As of January 17th there is a curfew in place by the GOT in the Savanes prefectures of Tone, Kpendjal, West Kpendjal, and Tanjouare remain in effect with no end date.  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210220172231/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104230410/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/togo  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210221170510/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Passenger's must have a negative COVID test.  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210220172231/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104230410/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/togo  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210221170510/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

It appears according to IMF that informal workers could receive up to 30% of the minimum wage.  Additionally there appears to be subsidized water and electricity.  Suspending taxes for some private sector business.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210221170510/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

There are plans in place for suspending taxes and also allowing for flexible payments.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210221170510/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Support to the private sector is estimated at about 1 percent of GDP mainly because of measures that allowed for lower tax payments, including:   (i) suspension of all procedures for forced tax collections and ongoing tax prosecutions during the state of emergency;   (ii) rescheduling of submission deadlines for businesses that cannot submit their tax declarations on time;   (iii) small- and medium-sized enterprises permitted to pay taxes in tranches and enjoy more flexibility regarding outstanding taxes due; and   (iv) reduction of the standard VAT rate of 18 percent to 10 percent for firms in the hospitality and catering sectors.    http://web.archive.org/web/20220106085705/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

YES – The curfews implemented on January 17, 2021 by the GOT in the Savanes prefectures of Tone, Kpendjal, West Kpendjal, and Tanjouare remain in effect with no end date.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? NO (Subject to change)  All land border crossings with Ghana, Burkina Faso and Benin remain closed. If you reside outside of Togo in West Africa,  please contact the U.S. Embassy in your country for assistance. For a detailed list of the flights available in country, visit our COVID-19 page.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220104124228/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/

All land border crossings with Ghana, Burkina Faso and Benin remain closed.     * All passengers travelling to Lomé must show documentary proof of a negative COVID-19 PCR test within 3 days of traveling. You will be asked for the results of the test at boarding. The document containing proof of negative test results must also be uploaded as part of completing the traveller declaration form. Only passengers whose results are negative are allowed to travel.     * On arrival at Lomé Airport/LFW, all passengers will be subject to another mandatory COVID-19 PCR test at the terminal. Arrival must self-isolate until they receive COVID-19 PCR test results by SMS and email.    * All passengers who just arrived in Togo must install the contact tracing mobile application TOGO SAFE, and keep it activated for the entire duration of their stay or for at least 30 days. 	Failure to comply with the obligation to install this application will result in the traveler being placed under quarantine in a state-provided containment facility for at least 14 days. The traveler will bear all associated costs.    http://web.archive.org/web/20220426114450/https://tg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/security-and-travel-information/covid-19/    However, as of 04.15.2022 for fully vaccinated travellers arriving in Togo, PCR test is no longer required and will not be performed upon arrival either. Must still complete travel declaration form and download contact tracing application.   http://web.archive.org/web/20220426114935/https://voyage.gouv.tg/?language=en

In July 2020, the government launched TogoSafe, a web portal and a mobile app designed to facilitate contact tracing through digital geolocation, enable compliance with COVID-19 procedures by incoming and outgoing travelers, and to share test results through contactless means, including email and SMS alerts.  No additional information found on how exactly this contact tracing app (TogoSafe) works.    Link: https://archive.ph/oYT7U
